entry.title: his victory in the 1996 presidential election, Bill Clinton (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that with his victory in the 1996 presidential election, Bill Clinton (pictured) became the first Democrat to win two consecutive presidential elections since Franklin D. Roosevelt?

entry.title: The 40-Year-Old Virgin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Steve Carell insisted his chest genuinely be waxed in a scene in The 40-Year-Old Virgin, which was recorded in a single take?

entry.title: Pedro Aparicio Sánchez (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the mayor of Málaga, Pedro Aparicio Sánchez, spent the night of the 1981 Spanish coup d'état attempt in his office so he could die there if he was targeted?

entry.title: The Witcher (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that although its publisher Dark Horse Comics is American, a significant proportion of artists involved with the comic book series The Witcher have been Polish?

entry.title: Vera Schoenenberg (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Vera Schoenenberg's performance in the title role of Kálmán's Die Csárdásfürstin at the Mörbisch Lake Festival was broadcast by German and Austrian stations?

entry.title: Who Has Seen the Wind? (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Yoko Ono took the first verse of her 1970 song "Who Has Seen the Wind?" from a 19th century poem written by Christina Rossetti?

entry.title: Alfie Oakes (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Alfie Oakes sued a school district for US$50 million in response to their cancelling a contract?

entry.title: Payne Whitney House (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that no one knows how a dress worn by Marilyn Monroe ended up in the Payne Whitney House?
